thread.title: In case you didn’t know, Emma Roberts is incredible at recommending books on her Instagram
thread.title_full: In case you didn’t know, Emma Roberts is incredible at recommending books on her Instagram

author: Johnni Macke
title: In case you didn’t know, Emma Roberts is incredible at recommending books on her Instagram
text:
In case you didn’t know, Emma Roberts is incredible at recommending books on her Instagram In case you missed it — which you totally might’ve — Emma Roberts gives great book recommendations on Instagram . While it might not be an official book club, we’re definitely joining in.
On Sunday, Roberts posted a photo of herself in a giant bookstore, proving she is in fact a HUGE bookworm. This picture got us to thinking about all of the fabulous books that the Scream Queens star reads and shares on social media.
You might not have noticed, but the 25-year-old actress is always reading. Better than that, she’s always posting pictures using the hashtag, #currentlyreading, and now we’re taking notes.

A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Feb 5, 2017 at 11:41am PST 
While looking at Robert’s Instagram account we’ve found seven books she’s read in the last year that you need on your book list ASAP.
1. When Watched by Leopoldine Core Currently Reading: @leopoldinecore Currently Working: @aboutaboyd Special Trinkets: @jupiterlala 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Jan 24, 2017 at 3:23pm PST 
The newest book that Roberts is reading is When Watched . It is a collection of essays from author Leopoldine Core. She takes you through New York City with 20 stories on a variety of topics, each one relatable, daring and totally refreshing.
2. Jane: A Murder by Maggie Nelson Currently reading 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Jan 9, 2017 at 2:51pm PST 
In need of something a little darker and haunting? Then Jane: A Murder is for you. This book tells the story about the life and death of author Maggie Nelson’s aunt Jane, who was murdered in 1969. The story explores the murder through a collage of poetry, prose, newspapers clippings and pieces of Jane’s diaries.
3. Still Life with Woodpecker by Tom Robbins 
A book I always come back to #stilllifewithwoodpecker 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Dec 12, 2016 at 8:14pm PST 
This novel is one that the actress always finds herself coming back to, which makes us want to read it even more. Still Life with Woodpecker is actually a love story, but it takes place inside a pack of cigarettes. Yes, you read that correctly.
4. The Guineveres: A Novel by Sarah Domet 
Fresh juice and a fresh read #CurrentlyReading #Sunday #HomeSweetHome @sarahdomet @juicero 
A video posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Nov 27, 2016 at 9:26am PST 
Need a book that pairs perfectly with juicing? According to the former Nickelodeon star, this is it. The Guineveres is all about friendship. It revolves around four best friends all named “Guinevere,” aka Vere, Gwen, Ginny and Win. They only have each other, and together they overcome everything.
5. I’ll Tell You in Person by Chloe Caldwell 
#CurrentlyReading this Halloween with my gorgeous new @jupiterlala ring and @theearthsgems crystal for protection @chloeeeesimonne #IllTellYouInPerson 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Oct 31, 2016 at 8:12pm PDT 
Roberts read this 2016 novel during Halloween, with a crystal by her side, and therefore we plan to do the same. I’ll Tell You in Person is a collection of essays that is smart and to the point. It tells tales of failing at love, getting addicted to people, and more.
6. Pond by Claire-Louise Bennett 
I love October days ❤️ #CurrentlyReading 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Oct 18, 2016 at 2:04pm PDT 
The cover alone makes us want to dive into this novel right now. Pond isn’t for the faint of heart. It depicts the ups and downs of living in solitude in a coastal town. It makes you see a world that is dark, funny and somehow moving all at the same time.
7. Slow Days, Fast Company: The World, the Flesh, and L.A. by Eve Babitz #CurrentlyReading this delicious book #EveBabitz 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Sep 19, 2016 at 1:56pm PDT 
Break out your popcorn for this one and prepare to go back in time. Slow Days, Fast Company takes place in Los Angeles during the 1960s. Author Eve Babitz gives you a glimpse into the past, and makes it relevant to today. She gives you a ’60s lens of LA that we’ve almost forgotten.
Which of Emma’s book club picks do you want to read first?
